column1: #text=Carrying a spare inner tube saves lots of time and trouble , since I have to carry a patch kit anyway .
#text=However , if I do n't have one , I can still fix a flat .
#text=First I turn the bike over , and remove the brake by opening the quick release lever .
#text=Then I remove the tire with its quick release lever .
#text=Now I inspect the outside of the tire , to try to find the source of the problem .
#text=I look for imbedded glass , thorns , cuts or tears .
#text=If I find a foreign object , I remove it .
#text=I deflate it , and push the side of the tire towards the middle , trying to expose the tube .
#text=If that fails , I use tire irons , if I have them .
#text=I shove one in on the opposite side of the wheel form the valve , and lever the edge of the tire out of the rim .
#text=Then I put in the next tire iron about three spokes away and try to lift the section of tire in between up and away from the rim .
#text=This makes it possible to take the whole tire out and remove it .
#text=I look for the leak inside the tire , and then on the tube .
#text=I deflate the tube by pushing the valve center until I hear air hiss .
#text=If I can not find the leak , I put the tube in a bucket of water and look for bubbles .
#text=If I can not do that , I listen , and then I look around the valve .
#text=I also inspect the inside of the tire .
#text=I clean the outside of the tire near the leak as much as I can .
#text=Then I roughen the area with the scratchy thing provided .
#text=I spread the foul-smelling glue , let it dry until it is tacky , and press on the patch , starting at its center , and being careful not to glue the tire to itself .
#text=Now I partially re-inflate the tube , and replace it in the tire , making sure the spoke cushion stays in place .
#text=I put the tire on the wheel , and check to see that the valve is pointed straight to the center .
#text=I re-inflate the tube , and then replace the wheel and reattach it and reattach the brake .
#text=And I turn the bike over again and ride .
